_data.title: Create a custom preloading screen in Angular
_data.description: I'm  quite sure that you know these kind of situations. You opened a web app and you are staring at a completely white screen - and nothing seems to happen.

children.value: I'm quite sure that you know these kind of situations. You opened a web app and you are staring at a completely white screen - and nothing seems to happen.
Wouldn't it be better if some kind of motion would tell you, the user, that something is happening in the background to get things ready for work?
The best method is to place the loading animations to our
, because Angular will remove everything inside the apps mounting pount.
To overcome the fact, that the styles need to be loaded if used from included sources we will place the used styles inside the
The following example uses one of Angular's built in provider
is a Dependency Injection token which can be used to provide one or more (use
// e.g. load specific app data from the server
For the loading animation we are using a spinner from
And thats all - users do have a nice loading screen while the app bootstraps and loads in the background.
